subject: Philosophy
title: Phenomenology: The Bridge
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Phenomenology: The Bridge.

hook.text: Edmund Husserl said philosophy had lost its way by ignoring lived experience.

buildup.text: Phenomenology studies how things appear to consciousness â€” the raw experience before theory.

discovery.text: Instead of asking 'what is real?' it asks 'how do we experience reality?' The shift was seismic.

twist.text: Heidegger, Sartre, and Merleau-Ponty all built their existentialism on Husserl's method.

climax.text: Phenomenology gave existentialism its toolkit: focus on lived experience, not abstract systems.

punchline.text: Before understanding the world, understand how you see it.

quiz.question: What does phenomenology study?
options: The physical structure of the brain
